Dialogue.Line: We're cutting it too fine. They're coming at us too fast. Seven hundred thousand now. Six ninety, six eighty. The speed of them, it's fantastic.
Take position from radar calibration estimates.
Angle ninety on zero four zero two. Distance now six ten thousand, six dead, five ninety.
What's the range of your machine?
Fifty thousand miles total destruction, ninety thousand partial.
Well, it would be as well not to miss then, wouldn't it.
We'll try a random shot. At least we'll see how the power bank reacts. Stand by to test laser. Blue button. Red on stand by.
Angle eighty eight on zero four zero one now. Distance closing. Five hundred thousand dead. Four ninety, four eighty.
Tanya, take a power reading on this. And fire!
Power maximum and normal.
Well, everybody? I think we stand a chance.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The meteorites continue on course.

Dialogue.Line: Angle eighty eight on zero four zero one and holding. Distance closing. Three fifty thousand, three forty, three thirty. Angle change. Eighty seven on zero four zero point nine nine recurring. Distance two eighty thousand, two seventy, two sixty.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The laser is fine tuned while the Doctor, Jamie and Corwyn watch.

Dialogue.Line: Stand by for further tests on lasers.
Power max one hundred. All systems green and steady.
Red on stand by. Fire.
Power maximum and normal. All systems operating.
Stand by for test blanket fire. Red on stand by.
Power max one thousand. All systems green and steady.
And fire.
Power maximum and normal. All systems operative.
Well, let'em all come. We're ready for them.
I think it is reasonable to assume that the Cybermen caused that star to go nova.
Deliberately causing the meteorites to deflect from their orbit to destroy the Wheel, you mean?
No. Not to destroy the Wheel. To make you want to use the laser. Then they sent in their Cybermats to attack the laser and destroy the Bernalium.
And then you'd search that drifting rocket and find a big crate.
With the Cybermen inside it.
Aye.
It was only way they could get into the Wheel.
And now you think they've repaired the laser.
They must have done, otherwise they'd be smashing up the Wheel, wouldn't they?
So you see this isn't just an attack by an alien race on a space station. The Cybermen have another purpose.
What?
They have an over-riding ambition to invade the Earth, plunder its mineral wealth, and somehow they see a way of doing it through this Wheel.
But how can we stop them?
I don't know.
Presumably these Cybermen disposed of the crewmembers of the rocket in space?
Hmm? Yes. Jamie, the Time Vector Generator from the Tardis. Where is it?
Oh you mean the gold rod thing?
Yes, yes, where is it?
You've got it. I put it your pocket in the rocket.
Are you sure?
Yes?
But I haven't got it.
You must have. Not unless it's fallen out when they were moving you. Is it important?
Important? Someone'll have to go over to the rocket to get it.
Good luck to them. Who's going?
Well, if Gemma can spare someone to show you how to make the journey.
Me?
Yes, of course. You're the only one who knows what it looks like besides me, and I'm much too busy. Besides, it's your fault that it's lost.
Mine?
Well, isn't it?
Well, yes. No! Doctor Corwyn. Oh Doctor. Och.
The meteorite shower is approaching the Wheel.
The weapons of the Earth humans have been tested and are operating. PLANNER [on monitor]: Phase six can be completed.
The Earth humans have set up a neutron field barrier on the perimeter of the section containing their room of Operations. PLANNER [on monitor]: Do not complete Phase Six. Initiate Plan Three.
Follow me.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Vallance and the Cyberman leave.

Dialogue.Line: Replace the field barrier now. We're through.
I'll see of it's clear ahead.
I still don't see why you should send a wee thing like that with me.
She is the only one I can spare who knows enough about space drill to get you across to that rocket safely.
Maybe so. I still think I'm better by myself.
Do you? I wouldn't be too sure if I were you.
Have you gone off your head?
She, she agreed to go.
She'd no right to agree. And you've got no right to let her.
I had to. Jamie will look after her.

Have you any idea of the dangers they'll face between the Wheel and the rocket? And you've send Zoe and your friend out into an area which is bound to be bombarded with small debris, quite apart from the radiation and the thermal shock.
Well, they knew the risk. Zoe calculated it.
Oh, yes, Zoe calculated it. And what about Gemma, hey? What if Gemma meets up with one of those Cyberman things?
Coming in to range now.
All right. Now you don't do anything unless I say so. Clear? Tanya, take a power reading on this. Rico, calculate distance and direction. All systems on stand by.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Corwyn, Zoe and Jamie find a crewman.

Dialogue.Line: He's dead.
Yes, I'm afraid so. Zoe, the emergency exit. You'll find space equipment in the airlock.
Come on, Jamie.
All right. You'd better take that.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He hands Corwyn the dead man's blaster and goes to the airlock.

Dialogue.Line: Good luck.
Thank you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Corwyn closes the airlock then goes to the video comm.

Dialogue.Line: Yes? CORWYN [on monitor]: We're through. No problems.
Good.
Main concentration coming into range.
Crossover on vector link. Countdown is from now.
Well, this is the big stuff. Angle ninety on zero three. Distance, one hundred thousand miles.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Corwyn hides behind a bank of machinery as Vallance enters carrying a small box. A Cyberman follows him.

Dialogue.Line: This controls the oxygen on the Space Station.
Yes.
Open it.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The box contains some silver capsules.

Dialogue.Line: Each section of the Wheel has a separate air supply.
(Yes.
Insert one capsule into each section. The oxygen will turn into pure ozone. The humans will die.
Fire! Fire! And fire!
Oh, it's hopeless. There's too many of them.
Shut up, Rico. Fire!
Angle change. Ten degrees.
Yes? CORWYN [on monitor]: Doctor, listen carefully. They're going to
Poison the air supply. Do you understand? poison the air supply?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor sees movement behind Corwyn.

Dialogue.Line: Tell Leo Ryan to switch over to the sectional supply unit.
Gemma, run! Get away from there! Run!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Corwyn fires her blaster. The Cyberman is slowed for a moment and Corwyn runs for the door but she is zapped and killed before she can open it.

Dialogue.Line: Gemma, can you hear me? Gemma! Gemma!
Angle of deviation ten degrees.
And fire!
Gemma!
Fire!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Several meteorites explode. Jamie and Zoe grab each others hand to try and stay together in the shock waves.

Dialogue.Line: We're hitting them!
What about Jamie and Zoe?
Leo, the shock radiation and blast
Fire!
But you must think about the two children.
I can't think about anything except those meteorites. Fire!
But Zoe and the boy will be
I can't help that. They'll have to take their chances. Range, Rico?
One eighty, one ninety.
Right, new sequence. Red on standby. Fire!
They'll be blown out of space.
Zoe calculated the risk. Let's hope she was right.
Fire! (More meteorites go Boom! and this time Jamie and Zoe can't hang onto each other in the shockwaves. They drift apart.)
The screen's clear, sir. We've done it. Main body deflected.
Any signs of Jamie and Zoe?
No, I won't be able to pick them up on the video screen until the static has cleared.
Well, keep it on blue stand by for now. There's bound to be a cloud of smaller stuff following on behind.
Yeah, okay.
And do a check on all circuits. Maintain all power levels till further notice.
No, I can't find them.

Watch out for smaller meteorites, Rico. Now then, you know what you've done, don't you? Those two kids out there have probably either been burnt up by radiation or fried by thermal blast. Always assuming, of course, they weren't actually hit by any of that rubbish.
Do you think I don't know that? It was a calculated risk that had to be taken.
Why?
Because there's something on board that rocket that we've got to have if we're going to beat the Cybermen.
And that justified risking two lives?
Yes, to save many. But anyway, we're all going to get killed shortly unless you switch over to sectional air supply.
What are you talking about?
The Cybermen are going to poison the air.
How do you know?
Gemma told me.
Where is she?
She's in the Oxygen room.
Right, well, I'll talk to her.
No, no. Well, you can't. She's dead.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ryan switches on the wall monitor and sees Corwyn's body lying on the floor.

Dialogue.Line: She sacrificed her life to warn us.
Here comes another swarm. Meteor bearing forty five, thirty six.
Right.
Any sign of Zoe and the boy?
No.
All systems on stand by. We'll try three second interval shots. Stand by to reinforce the anti-matter field around the Wheel. Maybe we can turn them off course.
Coming into range.
Right. Tanya, watch the power levels.
The Bernalium rods must be nearly burned out by now.
In range now. Bearing one eighty one ninety as before.
Red on stand by. Fire! Fire!
Power's dropping, Leo.
Switch over to anti-matter field projectors!
They're turning. We've deflected them!
Well, thank heavens. Hello, where's Jarvis? (Bennett is striding along a corridor. Lernov switches the wall monitor to different views searching for him.)
There he is. Jarvis! Jarvis, what are you doing? Jarvis, what are you doing? Come back. BENNETT [on monitor]: No, I'm going on. They've killed Gemma, you know.
Please come back. BENNETT [on monitor: I lifted the force field. You'd better replace it.
Leo, where are you going?
To bring him back.
No, wait. You're too late. Look!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Bennett turns to see the Cyberman walking up behind him.

Dialogue.Line: Jarvis, watch out!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Bennett walks towards the Cyberman, ready to grapple with it, but is easily overpowered. The control room watches in horror as the Cyberman lifts Bennett up over its head and throws him down the corridor. Then it zaps him with the chest unit ray.

Dialogue.Line: Turn it off. Turn it off!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie brings Zoe a drink with a straw.

Dialogue.Line: Here.
Oh, thanks, Jamie.
How do you feel now?
I didn't think we'd get through. I feel as if someone's been hitting me all over with small hammers.
Aye. Just you take it easy.
Oh, it's all right. I'll help. What's this thing like we're looking for?
It's about that long, gold, with a gold tip on one end and a white one on the other. Now, you're sure you're all right? Come on, then.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Large lava lamps are above the control panels.

Dialogue.Line: The meteorites have been destroyed. Now we will take over. You have inserted the capsule in the air supply?
Yes.
Inject it into the system. Effective penetration should be immediate. Report.
Negative. They must have switched over to the emergency supply.
That cannot be reached?
No. It is inside the force field.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Cyberman switches on his portable communicator.

Dialogue.Line: Do you report success?

No. Our plans are anticipated. PLANNER [on monitor]: Wait. The data will be computed. One of the Earth humans must have experience of our methods. Projection of all identities on the Wheel is essential.
Zoe, I've found the rod. Look! This is the

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Zoe has the Oxygen supply room on the monitor.

Dialogue.Line: The Cybermen. I must have broken in on their frequency. This may be important.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Cyberman communicates with Vallance via the head device.

Dialogue.Line: Stare into the box. Think of each individual human being at present on the Wheel. Form the image in your eyes.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Over the image of the Planner we see the crew as Vallance names them.

Dialogue.Line: Tanya Lernov, Astrogater, Second Class.
Negative.
Leo Ryan, Communications Officer.
Negative.
Jarvis Bennett, Space Station Controller.
Negative.
They seem to be talking about the whole crew of the Wheel, one after the other.
But why? What're they after?
Zoe Heriot, Astrophysicist.
Astrometricist, First Class.
Negative.
Doctor. I don't know who he is.
Name.
I don't know.
Name?
I don't know. I don't know
But what possible use could the Wheel be to these Cybermen, Doctor?
That remains to be seen.
I don't see why you don't accept my theory that they're simply attacking us.
But they wouldn't go to all this trouble just to knock out one small space Wheel.
Leo! There's something on radar.
What?
It's not a meteorite. Look, it's changing course.
There are no ships due in this part of space.
Anyway, it's too big for one of our ships.
It could be a Cyberman spaceship.
Moving in for the kill.
Possibly.
What about radio, Rico? We must contact Earth for assistance.
Oh no, not a chance, though I could fix it up okay but I need some transistors and they're in the Power Room.
Then one of us will have to go and get 'em.
Positive. The Doctor is known and recorded. An enemy. He must be lured outside the force field and destroyed.
They're going to try and trap the Doctor. Come on, let's get back and warn him.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Looking at blueprints of the Wheel.

Dialogue.Line: And these are corridors leading to Power Room.
Well that's no good. We don't know where those Cybermen'll be.
How else is he going to get there? Though the cable tunnels?
No, no, they're blocked off here and here. That just leaves the emergency air tunnel. FLANNIGAN [on monitor]: Captain.
Flannigan! Where are you? FLANNIGAN [on monitor]: In the corridor outside the Spares and Workshop. I've got a whole bunch of them locked up in the Workshop.
Is the way clear through to the Power House? FLANNIGAN [on monitor]: It is, but they're melting down the doors. I can't hold them for much longer.

Well, look, one of us has got to come for some radio spares. Will you bottle them up as long as possible? FLANNIGAN [on monitor]: Right. I will seal off the other compartments but you'd better send someone quickly for them spares.
Right. FLANNIGAN [on monitor]: They may be trying the other doors.
Excuse me. Tell him I will go for the spares.
You? Well, surely it's better if I go.
I think that it's essential that I go.
All right, it's your neck. Look, Flannigan, the Doctor's coming for the spares. Now, hold them back for as long as you can. FLANNIGAN [on monitor]: I will meet up with the Doctor in corridor six.
Right.
Now listen, as soon as Flannigan comes through the force field, grab him!
Grab him? What for?
And he isn't coming here. Didn't you hear him? He's going to meet you in corridor six.
I somehow don't think he will. Now please do as I say. I'll have the map. Now remember, don't trust him. Check the metal plate on the back of his neck.
But you'll get

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Flannigan meets a Cyberman.

Dialogue.Line: The Doctor is coming to corridor six.
Return to the Operations room. Destroy the force field after they let you through.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie and Zoe are space-walking back to the Wheel.
The Doctor opens a grating in the wall and climbs through. He goes over to a trolley and picks up a small bottle.

Dialogue.Line: Ah, mercury.

Dialogue.Character: (He pockets the bottle, picks up a circuit board and checks the corridor outside is clear. Then he goes to a workbench and picks up some coils of wire.) DOCTOR
Dialogue.Line: Yes, I don't see why it shouldn't work.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Out of their spacesuits, Jamie and Zoe come in through the emergency exit and see Corwyn on the floor.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor Corwyn!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: She is clearly dead. They go up the steps. Shortly afterwards they walk through a door labelled Oxygen Supply room into -

Dialogue.Line: Flannigan!
What are you two doing wandering about? Them creatures are all over the place.
We know they are.
Follow me. This way's quicker.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Flannigan, Zoe and Jamie leave, the Cyberman and Vallance enter.

Dialogue.Line: The Doctor has not come.
He must have gone another way.
How?
Through the air tunnels. There is one leading to the Power Room.
Show me.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Flannigan enters with Jamie and Zoe. Ryan spots him and grabs him before he can touch a control panel.

Dialogue.Line: Hey, what you doing?
He led us here!
He was under Cyberman influence.
What?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ryan puts the anti-hypnosis device on the back of Flannigan's neck.

Dialogue.Line: Right, he'll be all right now. Sit him down over there for a while, Rico.
You mean he was being controlled?
Yes. You were dead lucky.
Aye. Here, where's the Doctor? The Cybermen are going to try and lure him away and trap him.
He's already gone.
What? DOCTOR [on monitor]: I've got the spares.
Doctor, be careful! DOCTOR [on monitor]: Jamie! Oh thank heavens. Are you and Zoe all right?
Yes. Now listen. The Cybermen know you're on the Wheel. They're going to try and trap you. DOCTOR [on monitor]: Yes, yes, I guessed they would. Have you got the Time Vector Generator?
Yes. DOCTOR [on monitor]: Good! Now, now listen to me, I want you to bring it to me. Get someone to show you the way through the air corridors. Hello. I think I've got company.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Transmission ends.

Dialogue.Line: Company? What does he mean? (the penny drops) Company!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Two Cyberman are standing in front of the door.

Dialogue.Line: I suppose you've come for me. CYBERMAN 1: You know our ways.
Yes, I thought you'd realise somebody did. I imagine you have orders to destroy me. CYBERMAN 2: Yes.
Tell me one thing. Why did you order Duggan to destroy radio communication with the Earth? After all, that is why you want possession of the Wheel, isn't it? CYBERMAN 1: You know our ways.
That doesn't answer my question. CYBERMAN 2: He was instructed to destroy only the transmitting complex.

Oh, I see. How interesting. Yes, of course. And presumably your large spaceship holds your invasion fleet, and the smaller ships can only enter the Earth's atmosphere by homing on a radio beam. CYBERMAN 2: You know our ways. You must be destroyed.
Yes, well, I was afraid you'd get back to that. Well, you'd better come in.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cyberman 1 steps forward, the Doctor throws a switch and electricity crackles through its headpiece. It collapses. Number two tries to use its chest unit.

Dialogue.Line: You can't get through the field, you know. CYBERMAN 2: You will be destroyed. Others are coming.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cyberman 2 leaves. The Doctor turns off the electric field. Jamie comes through the grating with Flannigan.

Dialogue.Line: Jamie! Is he all right?
Yes.
I've got a head like a big bass drum. Somebody's going to pay for this.
Oh, it looks like the Doctor's already made one of them pay.

Yes, but they're sending in reinforcements, probably through the Loading Bay. Have you got the rod? Thank you. I'm going to try and fix this into the laser gun circuit. With any luck, I should be able to boost the power enough to destroy the Cyberman spaceship. But you'll have to hold them off at the loading bay. I need time.
Right, leave that to me.
Well, there's still a Cyberman left, so watch out for him.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Flannigan picks up a mini-extinguisher.

Dialogue.Line: Well, I think I know just the thing for him.
Good. Here's a metal plate for Vallance.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie catches it.

Dialogue.Line: Leo Ryan says you're to call him.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie leaves.

Dialogue.Line: Let's see how them creatures like this stuff!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Flannigan leaves.

Dialogue.Line: That ship's closing in on us. DOCTOR [on monitor]: I'm trying to put some extra power in your laser. Line it up on the Cyberman spaceship and I'll let you know when I'm ready.
Right. Well you'd better hurry, Doctor. That ship's moving toward us. DOCTOR [on monitor]: Yes, I know. They're going to invade us.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie and Flannigan are in full space suits. The Cyberman and Vallance are there. Vallance is also suited up.

Dialogue.Line: I could not get through the force field to the Operations room, and I caught this man on the way back.
He is not important.
Hurry, Doctor. Hurry!
Yes, all right.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A group of Cybermen are spacewalking to the Wheel. When the Cyberman turns his back, Flannigan and Jamie approach Vallance, and Jamie puts the metal plate on the back of his helmet.

Dialogue.Line: Got it! Flannigan!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Cyberman walks towards them so Flannigan uses his extinguisher device on its chest unit. It turns out to be quick drying plastic, and the Cyberman collapses as it reaches for the door controls. The spacewalking Cybermen are just paces away as Flannigan shuts the outer doors, but the lead one wedges itself between them and tries to force them open.

Dialogue.Line: Use the plastic again.
I can't. I wasted it all on the other one.
Right. Everything is ready here.
Ready, Leo.
Red on standby. And fire!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Cybermen's space ship goes KaBOOM!

Dialogue.Line: I'll try and operate the neutron force-field. Hold tight!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The forcefield repels the Cybermen, and the outer doors close. Flannigan repressurises the bay and they all remove their helmets.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, we've done it.
Earth Central, stand by for emergency report.
Earth Central. Contract clear. Standing by.
Where's Zoe?
She's gone to take the Doctor and Jamie back to the rocket.
Earth Central standing by with recording apparatus. Commence report.
Hello, Earth Central. This is Captain Ryan, acting controller of Station Three.
Recording in progress. Go ahead, Captain.

Preliminary report on communications failure. Radio contact lost at approximately twelve fifty two hours due to invasion of alien force. Full report to follow. All systems now operational. Request official permission to assume responsibility.
So I've just got to go back?
I'm afraid so.
And you won't tell me anything about this, what is it?
Tardis.
Oh, yes. I asked the Doctor what it meant. Time And Relative Dimensions In Space, he said.
Er, yes.
But you won't explain it.
Well, you see Zoe, it's, well, it's like two different worlds. Look, you've got yours and the Doctor and me have ours.
Jamie!
Look, you've been. Well, look, Zoe, we won't forget you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor pours the mercury through a funnel into the console, then switches on.

Dialogue.Line: All set?
Yes. I've even got some mercury left over.
Oh, we can go then.
Yes, I think

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The lid of a carved blanket box or chest lowers itself gently.

Dialogue.Line: Just a little matter to settle first, I think, Jamie.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor knocks on the lid and opens it.

Dialogue.Line: Hey, I thought I told you
I want to go with you.
Well, it's impossible.
Now, Jamie, it's not impossible. It's something that we have to decide. You may change your mind.
No, I won't.
I wonder. Zoe, watch the screen up there.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor takes a small head piece from behind a roundel and puts it on.

Dialogue.Line: What are you going to do?
I'm going to show Zoe the sort of thing that she may be in for.
Thought patterns?
Yes. Only I'm going to weave them into a complete story for you. Have you ever heard of the Daleks?
No.
Then watch. DALEK [on monitor]: Who are you? Who are you? Answer!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: That is the reprise from episode two of  Evil of the Daleks, which was repeated on BBC after this story.
